ygData.subject: Re: turning off transport in diffflame.m
ygData.msgSnippet: of course of course of course - thank you. simplest tweaks are often the best. was forgetting that it is not that I want _no_ transport, just all the same

of course of course of course - thank you. simplest tweaks are often
the be=
st. was forgetting that it is not that I want _no_ transport,
just all the =
same transport.

cheers, and have a good day

--- In cantera@...=
m, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
>
> Well, you can't run a flame prob=
lem without a transport model - it  
> needs to know how to compute diffusi=
on coefficients and thermal  
> conductivity somehow.   Can't you do what y=
ou want by giving all  
> species identical transport parameters?  If not, =
you would need to do  
> some C++ programming: derive a new transport manag=
er class from class  
> Transport, and in that class implement calculation =
of diffusion  
> coefficients however you like.
> 
> 
> On Nov 9, 2006, at =
2:39 AM, robgordon101 wrote:
> 
> > Hi,
> >
> > I'm running some cases with=
 a mod of the demo opposed flow flame
> > template "diffflame.m". I wish to=
 compare the cases with and without
> > differential diffusion (testing the=
 impact of Lewis Number =3D 1). The
> > default for the case is 'Mix' trans=
port.
> >
> > Now, I can create my own .cti files with and without transpor=
t
> > properties, and use ImportPhase etc, but the trouble I am encounterin=
g
> > is that the expectation for the 'Mix' trasnport mechanism is hardwire=
d
> > into the ctmethods.dll (if you follow the logic in the files in
> > r=
everse order below - it is called by domain_methods.m, which is
> > called =
by Domain1D.m, which is called by AxisymmetricFlow.m).
> >
> > Is there a w=
ay to run this with the transport mechanism turned off?
> >
> > regards
